comment: Super kind and understanding professor, grades assignments fast and gives helpful feedback.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor! Took his class online. Consisted of reading each week, powerpoint, assignment, and quiz. Assignments could be time consuming and he is a tough grader. No tests, but there is a final project. I recommend you take him!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Such an amazing teacher! Very understanding and helpful. If you make an easy blatant mistake he allows you to fix it so you do not lose credit. Explains exactly what you did wrong on all assignments. No tests. Fun assignments pretty easy quizzes. 100% recommend. Took online

I took Professor Long's course for PSYC 3375 this semester. This class helped me understand better about different career interventions, career counselors and coaches and what they do. We had 3 discussion boards, and weekly written assignments. You just follow the directions accurately and write in proper APA 7 with citations. I would recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor! We had either weekly quizzes or assignments to complete and they were pretty easy. He was also really quick at grading and gave good feedback. The assignments may seem tedious at first, but all were very simple and straight-forward. Highly recommend taking this professor, I'm sure he's good with other classes too.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: I have only been in this class for a few weeks but it has been great so far! Professor Long is accessible outside of class and super helpful if you are confused about grading criteria or assignments.

Professor Long is amazing. There is a quiz every week along with an assignment. Everything was always super easy and simple. His instructions can be a little unclear but he promptly responds to emails and answers any questions. There are quite a few papers but you get a week to do them and he is a pretty easy grader and he gives great feedback.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: He is a "Board Certified Career Coach," and makes sure to tell you that with almost every announcement posted for his online classes (shamelessly plugging his book, saying "the above content is from the book 'Career Judo' and used with permission from the author John E. Long). I found this horrible cheesy. He lets you work ahead -- the only part.

This guy was the best teacher ever. He was a great way to start off my first semester of college. He was really straight forward and understanding. If you had to miss class he was okay with it but attendance does matter. Participate in class, get to know him a little, and you should be good to go. Barely any homework and only 2 test!

Prof Long is one of the most amazing, inspirational, and awesome professors I have ever had. He really cares about you, is very understanding, and is a wonderful person. He does his best to make the class fun, but still expects you to do your part. There are several presentations, the midterm, and final, it's an easy A. ABSOLUTELY take him.

Great prof. class is pretty easy there a lot of projects but they aren't that bad. Attendance isn't really mandatory but the class will definitely be easier if you show up and he gives extra point for people who are in class when a lot of the class skips.

Prof Long makes the best out of a boring seminar class. Lots of oral presentations, grades hard on those. He requires you to buy the online book but only used it like twice. There is quite a bit of work for this class, but it isn't hard. Only tests are midterm & final. He's a great person, laid back, and fun.

Nice professor. It felt more like a therapy class with busy work. Upset because I opened the book like once and KSU won't buy it back. Find someone in the class that you can share w/ if anything. I missed like maybe 2 or 3 classes and still got a good grade.
easy gen ed class, kinda boring, nice teacher (anecdotal),swear a little, little effort to get an A

Professor Long is a great teacher. He makes the class interesting. He gives a lot of projects that are mostly group projects. Easy class to take but you want to show up because he gives extra credit if you do. The textbooks are really recommendations (I never used mine). Take him!
